title:
"Indeed, of all the characters that a great artist creates, his readers are the best."

Let me define...

attachments.displayName:
"Indeed, of all the characters that a great artist creates, his readers are the best."

Let me define this admirable reader. He does not belong to any specific nation or class.  No director of conscience and no book club can manage his soul. ... The admirable reader does not seek information about Russia in a Russian novel, for he knows that the Russia of Tolstoy or Chekhov is not the average Russia of history but a specific world imagined and created ...

The admirable reader is not concerned with general ideas: he is interested in the particular vision ... he likes the novel because he imbibes and understands every detail of the text, enjoys what the author meant to be enjoyed, beams inwardly and all over, is thrilled by the magic imageries of the master forger, the fancy forger, the conjurer, the artist.

Excerpts from: Lectures on Russian literature by Vladimir Nabokov

Image still: The Russian Novel , Shin Yeon-shick

object.content:
